input_text:
Job Title: Construction Project Engineer

Location: Greater Milwaukee

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Selzer-Ornst Construction Company, a commercial construction firm with a rich history of service to southeast Wisconsin since 1928, is seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Project Engineer to join our team of rockstars. Grounded in our mission to enhance peoplesâ€™ lives through the spaces we create and the people we serve and develop, we are dedicated to our core values of serving people, taking initiative, leading the way, and staying humble. As a Project Engineer, you will be an essential contributor to the successful execution of construction projects that positively impact our community.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Collaborate closely with Project Managers, architects, designers, engineers, trade partners, clients, and other stakeholders to ensure project plans, specifications, and schedules are well-coordinated and followed.Assist in developing and maintaining comprehensive project documentation, including submittals, RFIs (Requests for Information), change orders, and progress reports.Review construction drawings, specifications, and other technical documents to ensure accuracy and compliance with project requirements.Support procurement activities by sourcing materials, obtaining quotes, and coordinating deliveries to maintain project timelines.Monitor project progress, track and report on work accomplishments, and assist in identifying and resolving any potential deviations from the project plan.Play an active role in ensuring the adherence of construction activities to safety protocols, industry regulations, and company standards.Manage project budgets and costs, working closely with the Project Manager and/or Executive to track expenses and analyze variances.Participate in project meetings, taking minutes, facilitating discussions, and maintaining open lines of communication among project stakeholders.Aid in maintaining positive relationships with clients, trade partners, suppliers, and other external parties involved in the project.Support continuous improvement efforts by suggesting and implementing process enhancements and best practices. 
PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architectural Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Exposure to commercial construction projects preferred.Familiarity with construction documents, drawings, and specifications.Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and industry practices.Proficiency in project management software and tools is advantageous.
IDEAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate documentation and project coordination.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, for clear and concise information exchange.Collaborative mindset with the ability to work well within multidisciplinary teams.Proficiency in using construction-related software and tools.Problem-solving orientation with the capability to identify and address challenges.Eagerness to learn, adapt, and grow within the construction industry.Demonstrated commitment to safety and adherence to industry regulations.Self-motivated and proactive attitude with a willingness to take initiative.Flexibility to manage multiple tasks and adapt to changing priorities.
Join Selzer-Ornst Construction Company and contribute to our legacy of constructing exceptional spaces that positively impact communities. As a Project Engineer, you will embody our core values and take part in shaping the built environment throughout southeastern Wisconsin. If you are a dedicated professional seeking growth in the construction field, we invite you to apply and become an integral part of our dynamic team.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Construction Project Engineer
output_json.summary: Seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Project Engineer to join a commercial construction firm.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architectural Engineering, or a related field
optional_skills: Proficiency in construction-related software and tools
job_responsibilities: Collaborate with Project Managers, architects, designers, engineers, trade partners, clients, and other stakeholders.
Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Review construction drawings, specifications, and technical documents.
Monitor project progress and report on work accomplishments.
Ensure adherence to safety protocols, industry regulations, and company standards.
Participate in project meetings and maintain open lines of communication.
Maintain positive relationships with clients, trade partners, suppliers, and external parties.
output_json.company_information: Selzer-Ornst Construction Company, a commercial construction firm with a rich history of service to southeast Wisconsin since 1928.
